title: HTTPS for the website
body_html:
I am not sure if this repo is the right place to post this issue. If it is not, please point to where I could voice my concern.

pytorch.org contains command line that people are expected to execute. It also hosts pip wheel files on insecure connections. The lack of TLS protection is dangerous, as attackers may inject malicious content into the webpage and the download stream. The solution is to migrate to HTTPS for all URLs.

If I remember correctly, pytorch comes out from Facebook, which is also a major sponsor of Let's Encrypt initiative that aims to bring TLS to every corner of the Internet. It is a bit ironic that its own website does not share the same vision. Yet.

body:
I am not sure if this repo is the right place to post this issue. If it is not, please point to where I could voice my concern.

`pytorch.org` contains command line that people are expected to execute. It also hosts pip wheel files on insecure connections. The lack of TLS protection is dangerous, as attackers may inject malicious content into the webpage and the download stream. The solution is to migrate to HTTPS for all URLs.

If I remember correctly, pytorch comes out from Facebook, which is also a major sponsor of [Let's Encrypt](https://letsencrypt.org/) initiative that aims to bring TLS to every corner of the Internet. It is a bit ironic that its own website does not share the same vision. Yet.
